children.name: tactless
children.definition: sb who is tactless says or does things that offend other people or hurt their feelings, without intending to and without realizing that they have done it:
examples: He made all sorts of tactless remarks about her appearance.
it is tactless (of sb) to do sth
It was a bit tactless of you to start talking about her ex-boyfriend.
it is tactless to do sth
I wanted to know about her divorce but thought it would be tactless to ask.
tactlessly[adv] một cách thiếu suy nghĩ
‘Would you like to come and have dinner with me?’ asked Eddie, and then added tactlessly, ‘Someone I invited has cancelled.’

children.name: insensitive
children.definition: (of a person or their behaviour) not feeling or showing sympathy for other people's feelings, or refusing to give importance to sth: vô ý, vô tứ
examples: How could you be so insensitive?
It was a bit insensitive of Fiona to go on so much about fat people when she knows Mandy is desperate to lose weight.
The police have been criticized for being insensitivetocomplaints from the public.
insensitive to sb’s feelings/needs etc :
Doctors sometimes seem insensitive to their patients’ feelings.
insensitivity[U noun]
the insensitivity of some police officers in the way they treat rape victims

children.name: inconsiderate
children.definition: thoughtless/   sb who is thoughtless or inconsiderate only thinks about their own situation, their own enjoyment etc, and does not think about the effects that their actions will have on other people: thiếu suy nghĩ, cân nhắc
examples: A few thoughtless people have spoiled the holiday for everyone else.
I have an inconsiderate neighbour who plays loud music late at night.

children.name: it is thoughtless/ inconsiderate of sb to dosth
examples: It was thoughtless of him to mention her divorce when she’s so upset.
I’m sorry, it was inconsiderate of me to phone so early.

children.name: careless remarks/talk/words etc
children.definition: said without thinking about what effect they might have, and so often causing trouble or embarrassment: (nshững lời , từ...) vô ý
examples: You say a few careless words to a neighbour and suddenly everyone knows about it.
Witnesses say the argument started after a careless remark about the victim’s wife.

children.name: indiscreet
children.definition: careless about what you say, especially by talking about things that should be kept secret: vô ý tứ (nói ra điều gì nên được giữ kín)
examples: I wouldn’t trust him with anything personal - he can be very indiscreet.

children.name: it is indiscreet of sb to do sth
examples: I did hear them talking about sales figures but it would be indiscreet of me to say any more.
